document_data.name: Temple of Oghma
document_data.organizations: Organizations in the Temple of Oghma (Bezantur)
document_data.mainbody: The '''Temple of Oghma''' in [[Bezantur]], [[Thay]] was a place of worship dedicated to [[Oghma]].
document_data.Location: The temple was located in south-central Bezantur, the so-called "City of a Thousand Temples." Appropriately, it was surrounded by other temples, notably the [[Temple of Malar (Bezantur)|Temple of Malar]], the [[Temple of Shar (Bezantur)|Temple of Shar]], the [[Temple of Lliira (Bezantur)|Temple of Lliira]], the [[Temple of Helm (Bezantur)|Temple of Helm]], and the [[Temple of Umberlee (Bezantur)|Temple of Umberlee]].
document_data.Structure: It was a circular, white [[marble]] building with a colonnade.
document_data.Interior: The temple was primarily a library, boasting an extensive collection on topics ranging from history and religion to philosophy and science.
document_data.Activities: The local congregation was so small that it almost did not warrant a formal place of worship, however the [[church of Oghma]] maintained the temple in order to grow their knowledge about Thayan society.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Many supposed that the library contained tomes on the topics of [[magic]] and spellcasting, topics banned by the [[Red Wizards of Thay]]. If these rumors were ever proven to be true, the Red Wizards would have immediately sacked the temple and killed all inhabitants.
